information.name: Filtered Table Rows Number
information.description: This is a very simple example calculating rows number of a filtered table
author: Didier Terrien

mappings.description: Name of the measure DAX generator will create (click to modify)

mappings.displayName: Name of Table to be Filtered
mappings.description: Table we want to count rows (click to modify)
Column to be filtered. The column must belong to the table (click to modify)

mappings.displayName: Number or Text Value for Filter
mappings.description: Value the column will be filtered on (click to modify)
Name of folder that the measure will be placed in. (click to modify)
Add a description for this measure. (click to modify)

instructions: Choose a name for your measure clicking on 'Measure name'
Click on 'Parameter 1' and select a table from your model
Click on 'Parameter 2' and select a column from the table you selected
Click on 'Parameter 3' and select a value
Click on 'Create / update' button to create a measure in your model
Click on 'Debug' button to start a debug session with DAX debugger
